document_data.name: ''Kantlara''
document_data.mainbody: '''Kantlara''' were a special kind of vest worn by [[cleric]]s of [[Oghma]], the Lord of Knowledge.<ref name=FaA-p133">
document_data.Description: These vests were black and adorned in symbols sewn onto it in gold braid. The symbols were widely varying, with glyphs, runes, sigils, and other images of magical power, arcane significance, or important meaning from many realms and from many periods of history all known to be found on kantlara. These could be any size and could be placed anywhere on the vest, as the wearer preferred.<ref name=FaA-p133"/>
document_data.Usage:
When a priest of Oghma rose within the ranks of the clergy, they usually experienced a dream vision showing them a certain symbol, which they would then sew onto their kantlara using gold braid. As a result, each priest's ''kantlara'' was unique and deeply personal to them.<ref name=FaA-p133"/>

Should a priest somehow lose or be parted from their kantlara, they were permitted a replacement. This was a crimson or purple vest bearing the blank-scroll [[holy symbol]] of Oghma upon the back and the [[symbol of Chelsinara]] on each breast. Meaning "I learn," it depicted two cupped hands with thumbs touching and fingers pointing upward.<ref name=FaA-p133"/>

Loremaster [[Jaon]] had a kantlara made for her by her grandmother, who also a loremaster of Oghma.<ref>
